summary: The Minority Entrepreneurship Grant Program Act of 2025 aims to foster minority business ownership and entrepreneurship. It mandates the Small Business Administration (SBA), in consultation with the Under Secretary of Commerce for Minority Business Development, to establish a grant program for minority-serving institutions and historically Black colleges and universities. The bill defines key terms, outlines the application process, specifies grant amounts ($250,000 minimum), and details reporting requirements. An advisory board will provide recommendations. The bill authorizes $50,000,000 in appropriations.
